etymology.description: Depicts a foot in motion -> go
etymology.interpretation: The character 夂(夂) (zhǐ, "go") visually represents a foot taking a step, signifying movement or the action of going. This character captures the essential concept of movement through its simplistic depiction.

examples.chinese: 旅人夂向远方(旅人夊向遠方)。
examples.english: The traveler goes toward the distance.

examples.chinese: 学者夂求知(學者夊求知)，心怀天下(心懷天下)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě zhǐ qiúzhī, xīn huái tiānxià.
examples.english: The scholar goes seeking knowledge, with a heart embracing the world.

examples.chinese: 杜甫夂于长安(杜甫夊於長安)，吟诗抒怀(吟詩抒懷)。
examples.pinyin: Dùfǔ zhǐ yú Cháng'ān, yín shī shūhuái.
examples.english: Du Fu goes in Chang'an, reciting poetry to express his emotions.
